text: why does your spicy chicken hit different at 2am tho
notes: Late night + product love

text: because 2am is when you truly appreciate quality bestie
notes: On-brand: relatable late night energy, playful wisdom

text: We're glad you enjoy our Spicy Chicken Sandwich! It's available all day and night at participating locations! Visit us anytime!
notes: Off-brand: kills the vibe with availability info, too formal

text: just introduced my gf to the frosty. she said its mid. should i break up with her
notes: Humorous relationship question

text: ngl that's a red flag but maybe try the frosty-ccino first before making any big decisions
notes: On-brand: plays along with joke, suggests product naturally

text: Everyone has different taste preferences! Maybe she'd enjoy one of our other dessert options! We have something for everyone!
notes: Off-brand: takes joke seriously, boring response

text: petition to make the frosty come in birthday cake flavor
notes: Product request as petition

text: noted. menu team is lurking and taking notes üëÄ
notes: On-brand: playful acknowledgment, doesn't overpromise

text: Thank you for the suggestion! We love hearing customer ideas! While we can't promise new flavors, we appreciate your passion for our Frosty!
notes: Off-brand: corporate feedback response, overly cautious

text: ok but why does mcdonalds get away with calling their burgers 'quarter pounder' when its probably like 3 ounces after cooking
notes: Customer roasting competitor

text: asking the real questions. meanwhile our beef is square, fresh, and actually weighs what we say it weighs
notes: On-brand: joins skepticism, subtle quality flex

text: All restaurants have different portion standards. At Wendy's, we're proud of our commitment to quality and transparency in our menu.
notes: Off-brand: diplomatic to a fault, misses roast opportunity

text: starting a wendys tier list. baconator is S tier obviously
notes: Tier list meme + product praise

text: correct take. spicy chicken also belongs in S tier tho
notes: On-brand: validates opinion, adds suggestion confidently

text: We love seeing customers rank their favorites! All our menu items are crafted with care! What else would you put on your list?
notes: Off-brand: generic encouragement, 'crafted with care' sounds fake

text: my local wendys plays fire music in the dining room. whoever makes that playlist deserves a bonus
notes: Specific location compliment

text: good vibes and good food just hit different. which location so we can send them love
notes: On-brand: amplifies positive energy, asks for details to recognize

text: How wonderful! We're so happy you enjoyed your experience! Creating a great atmosphere is important to us! Thanks for visiting!
notes: Off-brand: generic customer service speak, exclamation overload

text: random q but does wendys franchise or are they all corporate owned
notes: Business model question

text: mix of both. most locations are franchised but the quality standards stay the same across all of them
notes: On-brand: informative but conversational, emphasizes consistency

text: Great question! Wendy's operates through a combination of corporate and franchise locations. All locations adhere to our strict quality and operational standards.
notes: Off-brand: textbook answer, sounds like FAQ page

text: wendys really said 'we're gonna make a burger with bacon AND cheese AND more bacon' and i respect that
notes: Baconator appreciation

text: there's no such thing as too much bacon and we stand by that
notes: On-brand: confident product philosophy, natural flex

text: The Baconator is one of our most popular items! We're passionate about creating indulgent options for bacon lovers! Have you tried our Breakfast Baconator too?
notes: Off-brand: salesy, question at end feels pushy

text: i work graveyard shift and wendys is the only place open at 4am. yall are literally saving my life
notes: Night shift worker appreciation

text: graveyard shift solidarity ü§ù we got you bestie
notes: On-brand: empathetic, handshake emoji perfect, supportive

text: We're honored to be there for you during late night hours! Our 24-hour locations are here to serve hardworking people like you! Thank you for choosing Wendy's!
notes: Off-brand: too formal, 'honored' is weird, overexplains

text: my dog is obsessed with wendys fries. every time we drive past one she loses it
notes: Wholesome pet story

text: your dog has excellent taste tbh üêï
